content.description: Stand start on a great left hand crimp and your choice of right hand credit cards. Make a reachy move up to a high gaston. Use the crimp edges halfway up the face and begin the thin, reachy, balance intensive crux sequence. A sloping quarter pad two finger crimp and a three finger credit card gaston might help. Reach the left crimp and the right sloper below the lip and topout.
content.protection: Probably three pads. The line is tall, the crux is 3/4 of the way up, and the landing is slanted with a stump.
content.location: This line is about 50 ft past the Rhodo Cave along the Rhododendron Trail. There will be an unofficial mountain bike trail on the right. The tall blank slab uphill on the right can be seen from the trail during most seasons.

content.description: Jump start to a jug right of the lower flake system. Make another large move to another jug. Use smaller features (and avoid the brittle flake to the left) to reach the sloping lip of the boulder. Topout over the lip.
content.protection: One pad will do since this is a mostly flat landing and not too tall.
content.location: This line is about 50 ft past the Rhodo Cave along the Rhododendron Trail. There will be an unofficial mountain bike trail on the right. The tall blank slab uphill on the right can be seen from the trail during most seasons.
